data.message: Welcome to your 11-day adventure in Japan! This itinerary is designed for couples who want to explore food, culture, all while balancing activities with relaxation. From iconic landmarks to hidden gems, every day brings new highlights. Let's dive in! üå∏

viatorEnhancements.title: Asakusa Senso-ji Temple and Old Tokyo Walking Tour
viatorEnhancements.description: The Asakusa Walking Tour in Tokyo offers a captivating exploration of the historic district, blending traditional and modern elements. The focal point, Senso-ji Temple, Tokyo's oldest Buddhist temple, stands with its Thunder Gate and Nakamise Shopping Street. Participants delve into the temple's history, exploring intricate architecture and partaking in rituals. Guides share compelling stories, enriching the understanding of Senso-ji's cultural significance. Meandering through Asakusa reveals charming shops, crafts, and local eateries, creating a vibrant tapestry. This immersive tour promises a sensory journey through Tokyo's cultural heritage, balancing ancient allure with dynamic energy.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Sens≈ç-ji with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo: Asakusa Senso-ji Temple & Old Town Walking Tour
viatorEnhancements.description:
Step into Tokyo‚Äôs past on this immersive Asakusa walking tour. Visit Senso-ji, the city‚Äôs oldest temple, pass through Kaminarimon Gate, and stroll Nakamise Street lined with shops, lanterns, and local treats. Once the heart of Edo-era culture, Asakusa still echoes with tradition. Your guide will share stories of geisha districts, hidden shrines, and the area‚Äôs evolution‚Äîrevealing both famous sights and hidden gems for a deeper connection to Japan‚Äôs living history.

„ÄêTour Highlights„Äë

„ÉªInsightful stories and cultural context shared along the way

„ÉªEngaging commentary on history and tradition during the tour

„ÉªLearn fascinating cultural insights and historical details as you explore

„ÉªExpert narration highlighting Asakusa‚Äôs rich heritage

„ÉªA guided journey filled with history, legends, and cultural background
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Sens≈ç-ji with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo: Private Asakusa & Senso-ji Temple Tour with 3 food stops
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover the best of Asakusa through its many unique sides!

You‚Äôll learn about the rich history and spiritual depth of Senso-ji Temple by a friendly yet knowledgeable expert guide, feel the lively energy of Nakamise Street with its colorful shops and friendly vendors, and enjoy three local foods loved by Japanese people‚Äîalready included in the tour. 
The area is filled with traditional goods and unique items that show Asakusa‚Äôs character, and you can also experience Japan‚Äôs kitchen culture by seeing beautifully crafted tableware made with traditional techniques in the nearby Kappabashi district.

Discover Japan through the eyes of a local guide!

„ÉªVisit Senso-ji Temple and learn its rich, fascinating history from a friendly and knowledgeable local guide.
„ÉªStroll through Nakamise Street and enjoy three hand-picked street foods selected by your local guide.
„ÉªHear cultural insights and stories that a Japanese local guide is especially able to share.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Sens≈ç-ji

viatorEnhancements.title: Nezu Shrine and Yanaka: Afternoon Downtown Walking Tour
viatorEnhancements.description:
This walking tour takes you to Yanaka, a traditional downtown area where the local people's lives are still alive, and the historic Nezu Shrine with its vermilion torii (shrine gates). 
As a hometown for many artists, it is also dotted with art museums and art galleries. Let's explore Yanaka, a good old town with small temples and unique shops.

This is a tour of shrines and temples this area, one of the best temple towns in Tokyo. The city is home to many artists, as it has one of the best art universities in Japan. 
We will visit art galleries. 
We will also visiting a small temple with deep roots in the local community. 
We will visit a downtown shopping street where you can feel the life of local people.
One drink is included. You can enjoy a relaxing break at a caf√©. 

A certified guide will take you around the area.

There are many narrow alleys in the area, but with the professional guide, you will not get lost and will be able to enjoy the hard-to-understand paths.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Neko Shrine & caf√© with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo Yanaka Old Town Walking Tour (Private/Local guide)
viatorEnhancements.description:
Highlight:
-Guided by a local
-Learn about Japanese aesthetics and religion at local shrines and temples.
-Experience Tokyo‚Äôs daily life through caf√©s, street food, and hidden alleys.
-Visit galleries, antique shops, and craft stores in Tokyo‚Äôs artistic area.

Tour Plan (3 hours / Private):
The tour price includes a drink at a local caf√© and street food.
Meet at Nezu Station / End at Nippori Station

Nezu Shrine > Hidden Alleyways > Cafe Break > Galleries, Antique & Craft Shops > Yanaka Ginza Street Food Walk

Step away from the rush of daily life and slow down with a stroll through the historic streets of the Yanaka, Nezu, and Sendagi area. This tour is all about soaking in the quiet charm of Tokyo, exploring its rich history, and enjoying little moments of discovery along the way.
I‚Äôll guide you through this special neighborhood with care, hoping it becomes a place you‚Äôll always remember.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Neko Shrine & caf√©

viatorEnhancements.title: Gotokuji and Setagaya Walking Tour: Home of the Lucky Cat Statue
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover a different side of Tokyo in this charming 3.0 hour walking tour through Setagaya, a leafy, upscale neighborhood known for its peaceful shrines, historic charm, and the birthplace of Japan‚Äôs beloved lucky cat. Perfect for those wanting to escape the crowds and see a more local, authentic side of the city all just a short ride from central Tokyo.

„ÉªVisit Gotokuji Temple, home to over 1,000 lucky cats and the legendary origin of the maneki-neko
„ÉªStroll through tranquil shrines like Setagaya Hachimangu and Shoinjinja, steeped in Edo and Meiji-era history
„ÉªExperience local life in stylish shopping streets and caf√©s, where Tokyo‚Äôs modern charm meets timeless tradition
„ÉªDuring the walk through the shopping street, enjoy a free drink (up to ¬•800)
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Neko Shrine & caf√© with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Harajuku Meiji Shrine Walking Tour in Tokyo
viatorEnhancements.description:
Explore the rich cultural tapestry of Tokyo on the Harajuku Meiji Shrine Walking Tour. This immersive 2 hours journey takes you through iconic sites, including the serene Meiji Shrine and vibrant Takeshita Street, all while uncovering the stories that shaped Tokyo's unique street culture. With a local guide, gain insider knowledge and appreciate the blend of tradition and modernity that defines this bustling city. Conveniently meet at JR Harajuku Station and conclude your tour at Omotesando, easily accessible by public transport.

- Duration: 2 hours of guided exploration
- Discover key sites like Meiji Shrine and Tokyu Plaza
- Group size is limited for a personalized experience
- Comfortable footwear recommended for walking around Tokyo
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Takeshita Street with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo: Harajuku From Meiji shrine to Shibuya Crossing
viatorEnhancements.description:
Embark on a captivating 2-hour journey through Tokyo's vibrant Harajuku district! Begin with Immersing yourself in the serenity of Meiji Jingu Shrine, guided by a knowledgeable local sharing its rich history, while making new friends in the process. 

Transitioning into modern Harajuku, stroll down the iconic Takeshita Street, and discover kawaii things that you like.

Walk on down to Shibuya, and at the renowned Shibuya Crossing, capture group photos against the pulsating city backdrop!
Continue to the famous Hachiko statue, where your guide unveils the sad tale behind this symbol of loyalty. 

Our adventure concludes with a fond farewell, overlooking the dynamic Shibuya Crossing from a scenic vantage point. Join us for a memorable blend of tradition, modernity, and the heartbeat of Tokyo!
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Takeshita Street with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo Harajuku Walking Tour Meiji Jingu Yoyogi Park and More
viatorEnhancements.description:
Explore the vibrant heart of Tokyo with a 3-hour walking tour through Harajuku's most iconic spots. Visit the serene Meiji Jingu Shrine, nestled in lush greenery, before heading to Yoyogi Park for a peaceful retreat in the city. Stroll along the lively Takeshita Street, the epicenter of youth fashion and pop culture, and discover the stylish Omotesando Avenue, known for its chic shopping and lifestyle. This small-group tour allows for personalized experiences led by local experts who share unique insights into Tokyo's rich culture and history.

- 3-hour guided walking tour of Harajuku's highlights
- Visit the famous Meiji Jingu Shrine and Yoyogi Park
- Explore the trendy Takeshita Street and Omotesando Avenue
- Small group sizes ensure a fun, social atmosphere, max 9 people
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Takeshita Street with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.description: This small group tour will allow you to know about the most authentic places to feel the spirituality of Saint Francis of Assisi.

viatorEnhancements.title: √âvora Walking Tour: Small Group Tour with Chapel of Bones Tickets
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover the historic city of √âvora, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, on a small-group tour with an experienced local guide. Explore the main attractions of √âvora's historic center, including the Chapel of Bones, a religious temple completely covered in human bones. The entrance of this monument it¬¥s included, with "skip the line" ticket.

Visit the Roman Temple and the medieval streets of √âvora. Learn about the city's rich history and culture from your guide.

Enjoy a fun and interactive experience with a small group of up to 16 people, in english.

Main Attractions
- Chapel Of Bones
- Roman Temple
- Giraldo Square
- Church of St. Francis
- Typical Crafts

Tour Themes
- Architecture/Urbanism
- Arts/Crafts
- Religious/Spiritual
- Myths/Legends
- Art History
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Franciscan Chapel Center with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Private √âvora Tour - Megaliths, Historical Center and Cork Region
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover the rich history, culture, and natural beauty of Alentejo: √âvora, a UNESCO World Heritage city, is known for its well-preserved Roman Temple, Gothic Cathedral, and the atmospheric Chapel of Bones. 

The surrounding area is filled with ancient megalithic structures such as the Almendres Cromlech and the Cromlech of Vale Maria do Meio, a glimpse into the past of the region and its ancient cultures. 

The landscape, characterized by the vast cork oak forests, is a must-see attraction, as it provides a beautiful and peaceful atmosphere, but also offers an insight into the region's traditional cork industry. 

On this tour, you'll also have the opportunity to visit a cork factory to learn all about the history of cork production and the process of making cork products.

There will also be time for lunch in a traditional regional restaurant, to sample the local cuisine. 

This is a truly unique and fulfilling experience that combines history, culture, and nature all in one.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Franciscan Chapel Center

viatorEnhancements.title: Shinjuku Kabukichou local areas Exploring Tour in Bar or Hot Bath
viatorEnhancements.description:
Kabukicho is one of the largest entertainment districts not only in Japan but in Asia.

As an electronics district and a financial district, it also has a rich entertainment culture and nightlife.

Rather than physical souvenirs, the best souvenirs will be fun memories of a different culture from a different country!

I will guide you around Shinjuku local areas. not only bars.
like big discount store [Don Quijote][Godzilla Head] ,and around Kabukicho.

You can experience traditional Japanese bars[Golden Gai][Memorable bai] & talking with other tourist and locals in metropolis Shinjuku.

If you want to go Japanese public bath ,I can guide you public hot bath[Sentou] near here ,even if you have a Tattoos.

Do you know [Hanazono shrine] is entertainer Deity spot?
You can see entertainer Deity in kabukityou area shrine.

By visiting local bars, public baths and shrines, you can learn about Japanese traditions and history, interact with the locals and get to know Japan on a deeper level.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Godzilla Store with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Tokyo: Shinjuku Night Adventure Kabukicho & Golden Local Bar Hop
viatorEnhancements.description:
Enjoy all that Shinjuku has to offer during the evening and night hours.
After meeting your guide at Shinjuku Station, you will first head to Kabukicho, the busiest shopping district in Japan. The neon signs glowing brightly, Godzilla's head peeking out from a building. The atmosphere of this bustling town is like no other.
Next stop is Golden Gai, lined with local bars, where a variety of unique establishments await you.
Discuss with your guide and ask him or her to take you to the stores you want to visit.
Don't worry if you don't speak Japanese, you can enjoy a night out in Shinjuku in just two hours.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Experience Godzilla Store in a magical evening setting

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyoto: Golden Pavilion and Ryoan-ji Zen Garden Guided Tour
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover two of Kyoto‚Äôs most iconic World Heritage sites in one unforgettable experience‚ÄîKinkaku-ji (Golden Pavilion) and Ryoan-ji Temple. Start your journey with these must-see landmarks, each offering a distinct glimpse into Japan‚Äôs rich cultural and spiritual heritage.

Marvel at the shimmering gold-leaf facade of Kinkaku-ji, perfectly mirrored in a tranquil pond, and explore its elegant gardens steeped in centuries of history. Then shift into quiet reflection at Ryoan-ji, home to Japan‚Äôs most famous Zen rock garden‚Äîa masterpiece of minimalism that invites calm and contemplation.

With insights from a knowledgeable local guide, this tour brings both the brilliance and serenity of Kyoto‚Äôs Zen tradition to life. Don‚Äôt miss this rare opportunity to experience two of the city‚Äôs most beloved and contrasting treasures in a single, expertly guided visit.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Ry≈çan-ji with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Kinkakuji and Ryoanji, must sees in Kyoto
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover the timeless allure of Kyoto's iconic temples with our Kinkakuji and Ryoanji must-sees in Kyoto. This journey invites you to explore two of the city's most renowned and serene treasures.

Begin your day at Kinkaku-ji, the Golden Pavilion, a UNESCO World Heritage site adorned in shimmering gold leaf. Explore the meticulously landscaped gardens and reflect by the tranquil pond that mirrors the temple's radiant beauty.

Continue to Ryoan-ji, where you'll encounter the enigmatic rock garden, a masterpiece of Zen minimalism. Find serenity amidst the carefully arranged stones, an oasis of peace and contemplation.

Whether you're drawn to the opulence of gold or the simplicity of stone, this tour promises a profound encounter with Kyoto's timeless treasures.

**Rain, shine, or a bit of both‚Äî our walking tours still go on!**
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Ry≈çan-ji with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyoto Full Course Tour: Explore 10 Must-See Sights & Hidden Gems
viatorEnhancements.description:
Welcome to Kyoto, Japan!

Let‚Äôs dive into and discover Kyoto's kaleidoscope of sights and sounds.
Explore as many as 10 attractions in the city on this full day tour.
We take you to the must-see sights and show you the hidden gems of each location.
Let‚Äôs stroll the city on foot and by bus like a local.

Transportation in Kyoto is very complicated.
However, all our guides were born and raised in Japan, have lived for a long time close to the area, and are well-trained expert locals.
So, we can take you to so many places, within a limited timeframe.

Though the tour, you can learn about our history, culture, society, values, etiquette, how to take public transportations, and everyday life.

„ÄêHighlights„Äë
(Meet at JR Saga-Arashiyama station at 8:50)
Arashiyama Area, Randen Tram Line, Ryoan-ji Temple, Conveyor belt sushi for lunch(Sushi, Vege-Sushi, Ramen, Kara-Age, Beer, Mochi too), Kinkakuji Temple, Fushimi Inari Shrine, Kiyomizu-zaka slope, Kiyomizu Temple, Yasaka Pagoda, Gion area
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Ry≈çan-ji with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyomai Dance by Maiko Geiko and Visits of Gion Art Museum Kyoto
viatorEnhancements.description:
An invitation to the graceful world of geiko and maiko in Gion woven over three centuries
The Gion Kobu quarter of Kyoto‚Äôs Kagai district embodies a centuries-old history. Although times have changed, ancient traditions continue to be passed down with great care. The Gion Kagai Art Museum, established in historic Gion-machi, is the only facility in the world where visitors can discover the sophisticated culture of geiko and maiko. Experience the pride of Kyoto‚Äôs Kagai culture and the spirit of our predecessors.

-Performance time is approximately 15 minutes (2 songs).
-Kyomai dance performances are usually performed by 1 maiko or geiko. On some days, the 3rd and 4th sessions may be performed by 2. 
-If you cannot find available ticket here, Please visit our website. 

In the Kagai districts of Kyoto, women who perform traditional dance in ozashiki banquet rooms and on stage and entertain guests are referred to as geiko (and not geisha). Women training to become geiko are called maiko.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Experience Gion Quarter in a magical evening setting

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyoto Full-Day Private Tour (Osaka departure) with Government-Licensed Guide
viatorEnhancements.description:
Temples, shrines, and tea ceremonies. The traditions of ancient Japan are still alive and well in the old capitol, Kyoto. Walking around this beautiful city can feel like you are in a time machine as its architecture has been preserved for centuries. Kiyomizu Temple towers over the historical Gion district, famous for its rich history of geisha. There is much history in this city that you don‚Äôt want to miss so book our Government Licensed and Experienced English-speaking guides for a walking tour of Kyoto!

Once your reservation is made, a guide will be in touch to plan your personalized tour. Choose 4 to 5 spots that you wish to visit and your guide will plan a personalized itinerary. If you do not know where to visit, ask the guide to send you their recommended itinerary based on your interests. Whether you are a history buff, love the beauty of old Japanese architecture, or just want to enjoy a green tea parfait, Kyoto has something for you!
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Gion Quarter

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Take transit from Kyoto Station to first activity

commuteToHotel.instructions: Take transit back to Kyoto Station

viatorEnhancements.title: Corsini Ceramics : Discover our Workshop and Decorate with Us
viatorEnhancements.description:
- Enters an artisan workshop active since 1957, in the heart of Chianti.
 - Discover the processes and secrets of Tuscan ceramics up close DA.
 - Experience the most creative part: decorate with your own hands a custom ceramic object, followed by expert craftsmen.
 - Bring with you an authentic and unrepeatable memory, fruit of your creativity.
 - End with a visit to the artisan shop, where you can admire Collections and unique handmade pieces.
An authentic experience that combines art and creativity, turning your visit into an unforgettable moment.
Let yourself be conquered by the real Tuscany: we are waiting for you in the heart of Chianti.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Hands-on learning experience near onko ceramic shop

viatorEnhancements.title: Unique Ceramics Pottery Workshop in Hanoi Old Quarter
viatorEnhancements.description:
- Expert Guidance: Learn from a skilled pottery teacher from the renowned Bat Trang ceramics village.
- Hands-On Experience: Engage in every step of pottery making, from molding clay to glazing and painting.
- Cultural Immersion: Explore a local pottery workshop and gain insights into the traditional craftsmanship of Vietnamese artisans.
- Convenient Location: Enjoy a "miniature Bat Trang" experience right in Hanoi's Old Quarter, without needing to travel far.
- Take Home a Creation: Bring home a unique, handcrafted pottery piece as a memorable souvenir.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Hands-on learning experience near onko ceramic shop

viatorEnhancements.title: Ceramic Making Experience in Zakynthos
viatorEnhancements.description: Have a great ceramic making experience! Get the chance to express yourself through pottery in this 2 and 1/2 hours ceramic class. Come with your friends or with your kids and play with clay while learning the basic skills of ceramic art. Make your own ceramics under the directions of ceramic artist Dionysia Avouri, the owner of Adamieion Ceramic Art Studio. During the workshop you create a turtle and a second more free form, with the style and decoration depending on your creativity and imagination! We fire your creations and you collect them after three (3) days or we send them to your home. The studio is located in a pleasant environment among olive trees and vineyards. Admire some of the oldest olive trees on the island, aged more than 1.000 years old! You, your friends and your kids are welcome to play and create with clay, away from the noisy tourist resorts. You have the opportunity to create your own unique souvenirs, your ...ceramic memories from your holidays in Zakynthos.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enhance your visit to onko ceramic shop with this unique experience

viatorEnhancements.title: Perfect Nara Park Half-Day Bus Tour with English Speaking Guide
viatorEnhancements.description:
**Important Notice**If you need to change the participation date or number of participants after making a reservation, please cancel your original booking and place a new one. Changes made without canceling the original reservation will not be accepted.

Discover the wonders of Nara on this immersive tour, visiting two UNESCO World Heritage Sites: Todaiji Temple, with its impressive Nandaimon Gate and the iconic Great Buddha Hall, and the serene Kasuga Taisha Shrine, known for its beautiful main shrine.

Experience the breathtaking views from the summit of Mt. Wakakusa, a grass-covered mountain offering a panoramic vista that will leave you in awe.

Our expert English-speaking guide will lead you throughout the day, providing insightful commentary and stories about these historical sites.

As a special bonus, you will receive a ‚ÄúNara-Yamatoji 2-Day Pass,‚Äù which allows unlimited rides on local buses within the designated area, along with an exclusive original handkerchief.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Kasuga Taisha Museum (Treasure Hall) with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: 1-Day Kyoto Uji & Nara Tour with Tea Ceremony
viatorEnhancements.description:
Embark on a captivating journey through Japan's cultural heartland with our Uji and Nara 1-Day Tour. This immersive excursion combines the serene beauty of Uji with the ancient wonders of Nara. Begin in Uji, the heart of Japanese tea culture, with an authentic tea ceremony and a visit to the UNESCO World Heritage Byodo-in Temple. Marvel at its restored Phoenix Hall, showcasing vibrant ancient architecture.

The afternoon takes you to historic Nara. Be awestruck by the Great Buddha at Todai-ji Temple and explore Kasuga Taisha Shrine's lantern-lined corridors. Enjoy a unique experience in Nara Park, where friendly deer roam freely.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Kasuga Taisha Museum (Treasure Hall) with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyoto & Nara Private Day Tour
viatorEnhancements.description:
Discover the cultural treasures of Kyoto and Nara on a captivating day tour. Begin in Kyoto, exploring iconic landmarks like the serene Arashiyama Bamboo Forest, renowned for its towering bamboo stalks. Visit the iconic Fushimi Inari Taisha, with its thousands of vermillion torii gates forming a mesmerizing tunnel through the forested hillside.

Next, venture to Nara, Japan's first capital, famous for its friendly deer and UNESCO World Heritage sites. Witness the majestic Todai-ji Temple, home to the world's largest bronze Buddha statue, and stroll through Nara Park, where sacred deer roam freely. 

Conclude your tour at Kasuga Taisha Shrine, adorned with thousands of vermilion lanterns. Reflect on the profound history and beauty of Kyoto and Nara, leaving you with cherished memories of Japan's cultural treasures.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Kasuga Taisha Museum (Treasure Hall)

viatorEnhancements.title: Private 4-hour Jewish Walking Tour in Athens
viatorEnhancements.description:
For this private tour, have your tour guide pick you up from central point in Plaka. 

Your first stop in Athens will be Beit Shalom Synagogue.

Close to it, you will see the ancient cemetery of Keramikos from the 8th century BC.

After that, you will get to see the new Jewish Museum, which is considered one of the most important Jewish museums in Europe.

After visiting the museum, the private guide will take you to the Acropolis, passing by the gates of the Holy Rock of Athens you will see the Propylaea, the Temple of Athena Nike, the temple of Erechtheion with the Maidens, and Parthenon

Later on, the private tour will continue to the center of the city, taking you to the central Syntagma square.

The total duration of the tour will be 4 hours. All the tickets are at your own expense.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Beit shalom

viatorEnhancements.title: Private Jewish Tour: S√£o Paulo Synagogues & Museums (5 Hours)
viatorEnhancements.description:
Shalom ve Baruch Haba!
Welcome to our Private Jewish Tour in S√£o Paulo, led by an expert guide who will take you on a fascinating journey through the history, culture, and traditions of the Jewish community in Brazil's largest city.

On this 5-hour tour, you'll discover significant sites such as S√£o Paulo's first synagogue, founded in 1912 in the Bom Retiro neighborhood, the traditional and Jewish neighborhood of Higien√≥polis, and the Jewish Museum of S√£o Paulo, which was recently restored and reopened to the public with modern and moving exhibitions.

We'll also visit a Beit Chabad synagogue, and to complete the experience, you can enjoy a meal at a kosher restaurant (optional). Along the way, your guide will also present other city landmarks and interesting facts.

Important tip: Museum admissions and meals are not included in the tour price.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Beit shalom

viatorEnhancements.title: Private Journey in Nara‚Äôs Historical Wonder
viatorEnhancements.description: Embark on an enriching journey through Nara, a city where history and nature intertwine beautifully, on this private, exclusive tour. Your family will be captivated by the majestic Todai-ji Temple, home to the world‚Äôs largest bronze Buddha. Roam the verdant paths of Nara Park, mingling with friendly deer that symbolize the city‚Äôs harmony with nature. Discover the spiritual serenity of Kasuga Taisha Shrine, adorned with ancient lanterns, and feel the historical significance at the UNESCO-listed Horyu-ji Temple. Explore the charming streets of Naramachi, a district echoing with tales of the past. Witness the architectural splendor of Kofuku-ji and Yakushiji temples, each an oasis of Buddhist heritage. Uncover the hidden beauty of Shinyakushiji Temple, and delve into Japan‚Äôs rich cultural history at the Nara National Museum. Stroll through Heij≈ç Palace Site Historical Park, imagining the grandeur of bygone eras. Visit Toshodai-ji Temple, a symbol of Nara‚Äôs enduring spiritual legacy.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Naramachi Museum

viatorEnhancements.title: Explore the Timeless Heritage of Nara from Kyoto
viatorEnhancements.description: Explore the deeper side of Nara, Japan‚Äôs ancient capital, on this enriching cultural tour. Begin at K≈çfuku-ji Temple, once central to the powerful Fujiwara clan. Admire its iconic Five-Story Pagoda and the National Treasure Museum, home to masterpieces like the Ashura statue. Wander through Naramachi, a charming old merchant district where traditional townhouses, artisan shops, and caf√©s reflect a blend of history and creativity. Next, visit the majestic T≈çdai-ji Temple, where the colossal Great Buddha (Daibutsu) awaits inside one of the world‚Äôs largest wooden buildings. End your journey in the peaceful beauty of Isuien Garden, a masterpiece of Japanese landscaping that harmonizes nature, architecture, and art. This tour goes beyond sightseeing‚Äîit‚Äôs a meaningful journey into the spirit of Japan through history, faith, and tradition.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Naramachi Museum with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Jakarta: Miniature Park, National Museum & Traditional House Tour
viatorEnhancements.description: Indonesia is the largest archipelago in the world with totally more than 17.000 islands. Indonesian territory is divided into 34 provinces, and each province has various ethnic groups, a total of ethnic groups in Indonesia is more than 1000 ethnic groups with different languages, cultures and ways of life. Created especially for those who have never been to Indonesia, this tour provides a glimpse introduction of Indonesia: The History, People, Culture, and Social life.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Traditional house with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Bali Cooking Class at Balinese Traditional House
viatorEnhancements.description:
Experience the complete journey of the day at Balinese Traditional House ‚ÄúKetut‚Äôs House‚Äù with Balinese authentic kitchen. Our chef will share his knowledge about the local ingredients you select that would be used during the cooking than prepare for your cooking class and refresh with a drink . During class, our chef will share his insights on how to prepare and cook few of locals‚Äô favorite authentic Indonesian dishes. Roll up your sleeve and start chopping. Enjoy the delicious Indonesian dishes you have prepared at the Balinese house overlooking the garden.
- Cook and eat with a Balinese family in their traditional walled compound. (Chef speak English)
- Learn to cook several dishes, then enjoy your creations
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Skip the queues at Traditional house with this priority access tour

viatorEnhancements.title: Japanese Cooking Class at a Traditional House in Nagano
viatorEnhancements.description:
The class is held at the over 130 years old house.
It was built in Machiya style and was used to be a house of Shoya, the biggest merchant in the city at that time. You can have a look around the unique inside.
We will show you traditional life style such as Koto, a Japanese harp and an old sawing machine, which have been carefully stored for a long time in Kura, an old style storage in back of the house.

The kitchen is made of Sake barrel lids came from a local brewery.
It‚Äôs located on the second floor, you will see the beautiful Japanese garden.

We provide aprons, so you don‚Äôt need to bring anything.
We will give you a recipe that you can cook at your country.
The class consists of some basics of Japanese cooking, such as how to make Dashi broth, and introduction of local made ingredients, which are not normally seen at regular supermarkets. We will explain for you to cook at home when you go back.

Recipes are adjustable for vegetarians and vegans.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Hands-on learning experience near Traditional house

viatorEnhancements.title: 1.5 Hour Food Tour at the Kuromon Market in Osaka
viatorEnhancements.description: Welcome to Kuromon Ichiba Market, Osaka‚Äôs vibrant food hub where you can indulge in a feast of fresh seafood, delicious street food, and authentic Japanese delicacies. Located in the heart of Osaka, this bustling market offers a sensory adventure with succulent sushi, tender tempura, savory takoyaki, and sweet mochi. Experience top-quality ingredients and traditional Japanese hospitality while sampling a wide range of dishes and immersing yourself in Osaka‚Äôs rich culinary culture.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Combine Kuromon Ichiba Market with local culinary experiences

viatorEnhancements.title: Osaka Flavor Walk Private Tour: Dotombori District & Beyond
viatorEnhancements.description: Experience the pulsating energy of Osaka on a tour through its vibrant heart, starting at the iconic Dotombori district. Begin your private, exclusive adventure with the famed Dotombori Glico Sign, a symbol of the city‚Äôs lively character and a popular spot for a quintessential Osaka photo. Immerse yourself in the dynamic Dotombori District, famous for its dazzling neon lights and an array of shops, theaters, and restaurants. This area truly epitomizes Osaka‚Äôs reputation as Japan‚Äôs kitchen, with endless opportunities to savor local delicacies like takoyaki and okonomiyaki. Next, delve into the bustling Minami (Namba) area, a nexus of entertainment, shopping, and nightlife. As you explore, pass by the charming Hozenji Yokocho alley, offering a stark contrast with its quaint, traditional eateries and tranquil atmosphere. Glimpse the culinary haven of Kuromon Ichiba Market, known for its fresh seafood and local produce, and the lively Misono Namba, a hub for various entertainments.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Kuromon Ichiba Market

viatorEnhancements.title: Deep Dive: Osaka Food Markets from Local to Luxurious!
viatorEnhancements.description:
Ohhhh Tokyo, with your big corporate headquarters and massive mobs of people doing very important things. And then Kyoto, with your high culture, fancy temples, gardens, and refinement. Yay. But this is OSAKA, and -- how to put it nicely? -- we don't care about your charmed lives. We care about eating.

Come see (1) an upscale department store marketplace, (2) the famous Kuromon Ichiba, where delicacies raw and cooked clamor for your tongue, (3) a Japanese infused Korea Town where few tourists venture to tread, and (4) a historic neighborhood resplendent with meats, fish, vegetables, plus other staples and stupefieables catering to locals. At your side will be a native English speaking, friendly, Osaka-infused soul, eager to explain every little aspect of this big world of food. Get ready to dig in on this adventure of sights, smells, and flavors!
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Combine Kuromon Ichiba Market with local culinary experiences

viatorEnhancements.title: Kyoto Full-Day Private Tour (Osaka departure) with Government-Licensed Guide
viatorEnhancements.description:
Temples, shrines, and tea ceremonies. The traditions of ancient Japan are still alive and well in the old capitol, Kyoto. Walking around this beautiful city can feel like you are in a time machine as its architecture has been preserved for centuries. Kiyomizu Temple towers over the historical Gion district, famous for its rich history of geisha. There is much history in this city that you don‚Äôt want to miss so book our Government Licensed and Experienced English-speaking guides for a walking tour of Kyoto!

Once your reservation is made, a guide will be in touch to plan your personalized tour. Choose 4 to 5 spots that you wish to visit and your guide will plan a personalized itinerary. If you do not know where to visit, ask the guide to send you their recommended itinerary based on your interests. Whether you are a history buff, love the beauty of old Japanese architecture, or just want to enjoy a green tea parfait, Kyoto has something for you!
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Umeda green bear fontaine

commuteFromHotel.instructions: Walk from Cross Hotel Osaka to first activity

viatorEnhancements.title: Half-Day Private Guided Tour to Osaka Minami
viatorEnhancements.description:
Come with us on foot to visit Minami, Osaka‚Äôs busiest area, for half a day!

We start with the American Village. To us the latest trends of young people in the region! Then we take a walk on Midosuji Avenue, the equivalent of the Champs-√âlys√©es in Osaka.

We go to Shinsaibashisuji, the shopping street, where you can find everything! The march continues along the Dotonbori River. The famous Glico Man welcomes us there.

We then pass Hozenji Yokocho, which denotes its traditional architecture, and we visit the peaceful Hozenji Buddhist temple.

A little further, Denden Town, Osaka's electronic and pop culture district! We stroll there before arriving at Shinsekai, with a retro atmosphere, and with its Tsutenkaku tower.

After this day, you will learn more about the contemporary history of Japan. You‚Äôll have had enough eyes full of this beautiful modern city! Are you coming? We are waiting for you!
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Minami Osaka Church

viatorEnhancements.title: The Deepest Drinking District! Osaka Bar Hopping Tour
viatorEnhancements.description:
The area between Shinsaibashi and Namba, known as Minami, is one of Osaka's most popular shopping districts. It has hundreds of years of history where geisha gather. It is also famous as a drinking district, where people from all over the Kansai region gather at night.
In this tour, your tour guide will introduce you to some of the best restaurants in the back streets and alleyways that only the locals know.
You will be sitting close to other customers, so you'll have a great time talking to the locals.
You can visit the bar beside the temple to enjoy whiskey, and enjoy cruising through Minami's nighttime cityscape and the classic ramen as a last meal on the day.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Get expert insights about Minami Osaka Church with a professional guide

viatorEnhancements.title: Osaka‚Äôs Best and Brightest: Private Full-Day Tour by Vehicle
viatorEnhancements.description: Looking for a full-day, private vehicle tour that covers top spots with a fun, knowledgeable, and truly fluent English speaker? You've found it. We show you Dotonbori, Osaka Castle, Shin-sekai, a view from high above, and more! Plus, get some local insight and interesting commentary at some of our other recommended stops. All of this at your pace, with your own personal driver/guide, and high quality vehicle service. Your guide is *guaranteed* to be a native English speaker or honest equivalent.
viatorEnhancements.matchReason: Enjoy an exclusive private experience at Minami Osaka Church

generalTips: Get a JR Pass for the Shinkansen and JR trains - saves money on Tokyo-Kyoto-Osaka route
Get a Suica or ICOCA card for easy transit payments
Download Google Maps offline for each city
Most shops accept credit cards, but keep ¬•10,000-20,000 cash for small vendors
Temple visits are best in early morning to avoid crowds
Many restaurants are cash-only, especially traditional ones
Convenience stores (7-Eleven, Lawson, FamilyMart) have great food and ATMs
Shoes off before entering traditional spaces - wear easy slip-on shoes
Trash cans are rare - carry a small bag for your waste
Tipping is not customary and can be considered rude
